Article.Abstract: Monoclonal antibody E5/G6 recognized a linear epitope common to hantavirus nucleocapsid proteins. Using synthetic peptides, we identified epitope E5/G6 as the 9 mer YEDVNGIRK (NP 165-173), in which D167, G170, I171, and R172 are indispensable. Furthermore, all the peptides synthesized using various hantavirus sequences bound MAb E5/G6 consistently, despite the existence of several amino acid variations in this region. These results indicate that MAb E5/G6 is a useful tool for detecting hantavirus antigen in rodent or patient tissues using Western blotting or other immunohistochemical assays.
Article.ArticleTitle: Epitope analysis of monoclonal antibody E5/G6, which binds to a linear epitope in the nucleocapsid protein of hantaviruses.
Article.Affiliations: Institute for Animal Experimentation, Graduate School of Medicine, Hokkaido University, Sapporo, Japan.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Antibodies, Monoclonal;Antibodies, Viral;Epitopes;Nucleocapsid Proteins;nucleocapsid protein, Puumala virus
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Antibodies, Monoclonal(immunology); Antibodies, Viral(chemistry; immunology); Epitopes(chemistry; immunology); Hantavirus(chemistry; immunology); Molecular Sequence Data; Nucleocapsid(chemistry; immunology); Nucleocapsid Proteins

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This epitope sequence was conserved in Hantaan (HTNV), Dobrava (DOBV), Saarameaa (SAAV), Amur (AMRV), Dabie Shan virus and MULV.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 to 5 doses of 5X10^6 Vero cells lysate, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The mAb was generated by fusing spleen cells from mice immunized with denatured NP of HTNV strain 76-118 with P3-X63.Ag8.U1. The details of the immunization procedure were described in the cited reference: Yoshimatsu K, 1996. J Gen Virol 77: 695–704. [PMID: 8627258].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The mAb E5/G6 cross-reacted to the epitope common in HTNV, DOBV, SAAV, AMRV, MULV and Dabie Shan virus by immunostaining assay.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was identified based on the SEOV sequence, but common to hantavirus nucleocapsid proteins and is also present in BCCV.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 to 5 doses of 5X10^6 Vero cells lysate, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: The mAb was generated by fusing spleen cells from mice immunized with denatured NP of HTNV strain 76-118 with P3-X63.Ag8.U1. The details of the immunization procedure were described in the cited reference: Yoshimatsu K, 1996. J Gen Virol 77: 695–704. [PMID: 8627258].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope was identified as the most effective minimum epitope for E5/G6 mAb binding by using thirty two 10-residue peptides (between NP140 and 180 of SEO/SR-11, 9 residue overlapping) and different truncates between residue 165 Try and residue 174 Pro. Residues D167, G170, I171, and R172 were indispensable residues, and Y165, E166, K173, and P174 were necessary for an effective reaction but not indispensable.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope specific mAb cross reacted to BAYV fragment 165-174 by immunostaining assay.
